data.title: Magic Mike Live! Official London Website
data.meta_description: Channing Tatum's Magic Mike Live is on stage at London's Hippodrome Casino. Don't miss out on the hottest show in the West End - book your tickets today!
data.text:
Channing Tatum

Conceived and Directed By

Channing Tatum has established himself as a leading actor and filmmaker.

Tatum and his two business partners, Reid Carolin and Peter Kiernan, founded their production company, Free Association, in 2014. They are currently in post-production on DOG, which Tatum co-directed with Carolin. The script was written by Carolin based upon a story by Carolin & Brett Rodriguez. The film is a road-trip comedy that tracks two hard-charging former Army Rangers paired against their will; Briggs (Tatum), and Lulu (a Belgian Malinois), as they race down the Pacific Coast in hopes of making it to a fellow soldier's funeral on time. Along the way, they‚Äôll drive each other completely crazy, confront the possibility that pet psychics are real, and begin to reckon with the one thing they were trained never to do: surrender. MGM will release the film domestically in 2021 while FilmNation will handle the international rights.

He will also star in an UNTITLED MONSTER PROJECT, which Free Association will produce alongside Phil Lord and Chris Miller. Reid Carolin had the original idea for the project and wrote the treatment. Wes Took is writing the script based on Carolin‚Äôs treatment.

Most recently, the Free Association team served as producers on Sony‚Äôs FATHERHOOD, starring Kevin Hart. They are in pre-production on SPACEMAN OF BOHEMIA for Netflix, with Adam Sandler starring and Johan Renck directing. They are also producing GORILLA AND THE BIRD for HBO, directed by Jean Marc Vall√©e, Netflix‚Äôs first animated film AMERICA: THE MOTION PITCTURE, and NEW YORK WILL EAT YOU ALIVE with STXFilm and Tencent Pictures, starring Colin Firth. Free Association has produced box office hit franchises including 21 JUMPSTREET, and MAGIC MIKE, as well as Steven Soderbergh‚Äôs LOGAN LUCKY, HBO‚Äôs WAR DOG and Amazon‚Äôs original series COMRADE DETECTIVE.

Tatum and Free Association also produce Magic Mike Live worldwide. The production launched in Las Vegas in 2016 and has since opened in London and Berlin and soon to open in Australia. The London production ranks in the top ten shows of all time for advanced ticket sales on West End.

Tatum‚Äôs recent film credits include Fox‚Äôs film KINGSMAN 2: THE GOLDEN CIRCLE (2017) alongside Taron Egerton, Julianne Moore, Colin Firth and Halle Berry.

In 2016, Tatum was seen in the Coen brothers‚Äô film HAIL, CAESAR! alongside George Clooney, Scarlett Johansson, Josh Brolin, Tilda Swinton and Jonah Hill.

In 2015 Tatum starred in Quentin Tarantino‚Äôs critically-acclaimed film THE HATEFUL EIGHT.

Also in 2015, he starred in the highly anticipated sequel, MAGIC MIKE XXL, which was written by Reid Carolin and directed by Greg Jacobs. The initial MAGIC MIKE was directed by Steven Soderbergh and released in 2012.

In 2014, Tatum received critical praise for his starring role in Sony Pictures Classics‚Äô acclaimed and Golden Globe nominated film, FOXCATCHER. The film was directed by Bennett Miller and also starred Mark Ruffalo and Steve Carell. The film is based on the true story of John du Pont, the paranoid schizophrenic heir to the du Pont chemical fortune, who built a wrestling training facility called Team Foxcatcher on his Pennsylvania estate and murdered Olympic wrestler Dave Schultz. Tatum portrays Dave‚Äôs brother, Mark Schultz.

Also in 2014, Tatum reprised his role as ‚ÄòJenko‚Äô in the blockbuster hit sequel 22 JUMP STREET, opposite Jonah Hill and directed by Chris Miller and Phil Lord. The film grossed over $234 million worldwide. The first film, 21 JUMP STREET, released in 2012 and brought in $200 million worldwide.

In 2012, Tatum starred opposite Rachel McAdams in Michael Sucsy‚Äôs film THE VOW. The Sony Pictures film earned $197 million worldwide and is the highest-grossing film for Sony Screen Gems.

In 2010, Tatum starred opposite Amanda Seyfried in the Sony Screen Gems‚Äô, DEAR JOHN, based on the adaptation of the Nicolas Sparks bestseller. Lasse Hallstrom directed the adapted script by Jamie Linden. The film made $142 million worldwide and is Screen Gems‚Äô third highest film to date.

In the start of his career, in 2006, Tatum received an Independent Spirit nomination and a Gotham Award nomination for his powerful role in the independent film, A GUIDE TO RECOGNIZING YOUR SAINTS, which won the Special Jury Prize for Best Ensemble Performance as well as the dramatic directing award for Dito Montiel at the 2006 Sundance Film Festival.

Tatum currently resides in Los Angeles.

Theophilus O. Bailey

Theophilus O. Bailey is a British dancer, movement director, choreographer and actor of Jamaican and Nigerian descent who has been pioneering the dance style Krump in the UK for well over 15 years now. An alumni member of Associate Artists at the Barbican, Boy Blue.

Better known for his stage and performance name 'Godson', Theophilus has also danced and choreographed for FKA Twigs, Fergie, Giggs, Swizz Beatz, Dua Lipa and Little Mix, among others.

He was movement director for Jacob Banks ‚ÄòParade‚Äô music video.

Theophilus continues to choreograph and movement direct. A few very special recent ones includes, Ryan Calais Cameron‚Äôs Award winning production For Black Boys who have considered suicide when the hue gets too heavy, for which Theophilus was also nominated by The Black British Theatre association for best Choreographer/Movement Director, which opened at The Royal Court Theatre in early 2022. Due to the success of the run, the play will be returning to West End this spring showcasing at the famous Apollo Theatre.

Theophilus also featured in Ivan Micheal Blackstock‚Äôs Traplord on Channel 4‚Äôs Random Acts. He also has worked with Kenrick ‚ÄòH20‚Äô Sandy as an Assistant Dance Captain and performer for the Opening Ceremony of the London 2012 Olympics and also one of the original cast members of the Laurence Olivier award nominated Blak Whyte Gray, which continues to tour internationally.

Additionally, Theophilus has now branched out into the acting world and made his debut in Steven Soderbergh‚Äôs Magic Mike‚Äôs Last Dance starring Channing Tatum and Salma Hayek.

Jake Brewer

Jake Brewer was born and raised in South East London where he originally set out to follow his Dad‚Äôs footsteps into the draughtsmen trade, but fell into acting and then found dancing at the age of 16.

He trained at Bird College before getting his first job performing with Carnival Cruise Lines, sailing around the Bahamas and Caribbean for months which was a dream. When he got back on land, he danced for Bananarama and new artist Lewis Capaldi in his Grace video, as well as modelling for Lululemon, Fairfax, Favour and most notably for Adidas as a body double for Gareth Bale.

Whenever he can, he jets off to Sweden to see his family and to get away from the hustle and bustle that comes with life in London. But as much as he's a city boy, he feels most at peace when he's in the sun and near the sea. Especially if he can scuba dive or snorkel, anything to get him in the water.

He's also a massive Marvel fan so if you have anything to say superhero related, he's your man. Forever hopeful that radioactive spiders exist üï∑üï∏

Marina Toybina

Costume Designer

Costume Designer Marina Toybina has been an integral part of painting the landscape of pop culture for over a decade

A look behind the scenes of many of the biggest pop acts of our time, would reveal a four-time Emmy Award-winning costume designer, Marina Toybina. Marina‚Äôs creations are seen worldwide in A- list concert tours, primetime television, films, music videos and numerous museums. After collaborating with high-profile artists on their world tours and establishing herself as a prominent designer for prime- time Television, Marina won her unprecedented fourth consecutive Emmy Award in the Outstanding Costumes For A Variety Program Or A Special category for her work on the Super Bowl

XLIX Halftime Show featuring Katy Perry and Missy Elliot at the 2015 Primetime Creative Arts Emmy Awards.

Marina has had the honor of working with many legendary artists on their world tours, including Taylor Swift‚Äôs ‚ÄúRed‚Äù World Tour, Carrie Underwood‚Äôs ‚Äú The Storyteller‚Äù and ‚ÄúBlown Away‚Äù Tours, Justin Bieber‚Äòs ‚ÄúBelieve‚Äù Promo Tour, Ariana Grande‚Äôs ‚ÄúHoneymoon‚Äù Tour, and Katy Perry‚Äôs ‚ÄúCalifornia Dreams‚Äù and ‚ÄúPrismatic‚Äù World Tours. In addition to this, Marina has created designs for Selena Gomez, Fifth Harmony, P!NK, NeYo, Usher, Miley Cyrus, Nicki Minaj and many more.

Marina‚Äôs recent venture includes the cast of Magic Mike Live at the Hard Rock in Las Vegas, Directed by Channing Tatum and Alison Faulk.

While establishing herself in the music industry, Marina also made a name for herself in prime-time Television. Marina has designed for FOX‚Äôs ‚ÄúSo You Think You Can Dance‚Äù for several seasons, ‚ÄúThe X Factor US,‚Äù and most recently NBC‚Äôs ‚ÄúWorld of Dance‚Äù produced by Jennifer Lopez. She has worked with artists on numerous awards shows, including but not limited to Selena Gomez for Billboard Awards and Dancing With the Stars, Taylor Swift & Carrie Underwood for multiple Grammy Awards, EMA‚Äôs and Brit Awards, Usher for Billboard Awards, David Guetta feat. NeYo and Akon for Billboard Awards, P!NK for the American Music Awards, Katy Perry for Grammy‚Äôs and Justin Bieber on The Voice, the Ellen DeGeneres Show and Billboard Awards.

Marina‚Äôs work has been featured on the cover of Billboard Magazine and has garnered high-profile coverage in publications such as US weekly, People, Rolling Stone Magazine, ELLE Brazil, Vogue Russia, Apparel News, NY Times, Country Weekly, NY Post, LA Times, The Hollywood Reporter, San Francisco Weekly, LA Weekly, USA Today and more.

Originating from Moscow, Russia, Marina and her family moved to Arizona at the age of 11. Marina‚Äôs parents worked hard to afford her opportunities when she made a bold choice to follow her aspirations to become a fashion/costume designer. She moved west to Los Angeles and graduated from the Fashion Institute of Design and Merchandising. Marina hopes her story will inspire young people to follow their dreams in the face of fear, doubt and or adversity.

Philip Gladwell

Lighting Designer

Philip is an international, award winning Lighting Designer based in London. He has lit all of the productions of Magic Mike Live (Las Vegas, London, Berlin) You may have seen his work in Australia on The James Plays at the Adelaide international Festival or Blanc de Blanc, Limbo Unhinged & Blanc de Blanc Encore at The Sydney Opera House. In November 2019 he was privilaged to light the opening show at the refubished Rechibite Hall in Perth with Boom Boom in the House of Casa Blah Blah.

UK & International Touring includes:

Hairspray, The King and I, Happy Days the Musical, Laila the Musical, Jackie the Musical, The James Plays; Trainspotting, Radio Times, Vulcan 7, After Miss Julie, Terminus.

Other work includes:

The Exorcist and Five Guys Named Mo in the West End; Cymbeline for the RSC; The World of Extreme Happiness and Love the Sinner at The National Theatre; A very very Very Dark Matter at The Bridge Theatre; Much Ado About Nothing at Shakespeare‚Äôs Globe; A Midsummer Night‚Äôs Dream at the Barbican; The Seagull at Regent‚Äôs Park; The Twits, Liberian Girl, God Bless the Child, The Ritual Slaughter of Gorge Mastromas, No Quarter, Oxford Street and Kebab at the Royal Court; Miss Julie at the Schaubhune (Berlin); Mr Burns and Before the Party at the Almeida; Testing The Echo for Out Of Joint; Roller Diner, First Love is Revolution, Pastoral, The Boy Who Fell into a Book, and Tape at Soho Theatre; The Infidel a Musical at Stratford East; Barnum at Menier Chocolate Factory; The Fahrenheit Twins for Told by an idiot; Milk, Swallow & Ciara at the Traverse; 1984, Macbeth, Too Clever by Half at The Royal Exchange Manchester; Punk Rock & Mogadishu at The Lyric Hammersmith; Small Hours at Hampstead Theatre; Amazonia, Ghosts, Member of the Wedding, at the Young Vic; Cos√≠ Fan Tutte at Welsh National Opera; After Dido for English National Opera; Il Trittico for Opera Zuid. www.PhilipGladwell.co.uk

Katie Zanca

Producer/Casting

As the Director of Worldwide Casting, Katie Zanca oversees the audition processes for all talent in every production of Magic Mike Live across the globe. Katie started her career as a musical theatre performer, but quickly transitioned to roles off the stage. Katie has worked as the Company Manager of Flat Rock Playhouse, the State Theatre of North Carolina, as a Talent Representative at Door 24 Entertainment working with artists in film, television, and theatre, and eventually found her true calling in casting at Binder Casting. With Binder, she helped to cast projects on Broadway/National Tours (Disney‚Äôs The Lion King, In Transit, White Christmas, Sister Act) Off-Broadway (NYCC‚Äôs Encores! Series, Chick Flick, Trip of Love) and regionally across the USA. As a former performer herself, Katie is passionate about helping artists realize their potential, and feels blessed to be surrounded by her MML teammates who share the same creative values. Raised in Connecticut, she received a BFA in Music Theatre from Elon University. She is based in Brooklyn, NY. Katie has worked as the Company Manager of Flat Rock Playhouse, the State Theatre of North Carolina, as a Talent Representative at Door 24 Entertainment working with artists in film, television, and theatre, and eventually found her true calling in casting at Binder Casting. With Binder, she helped to cast projects on Broadway/National Tours (Disney‚Äôs The Lion King, In Transit, White Christmas, Sister Act) Off-Broadway (NYCC‚Äôs Encores! Series, Chick Flick, Trip of Love) and regionally across the USA. As a former performer herself, Katie is passionate about helping artists realize their potential, and feels blessed to be surrounded by her MML teammates who share the same creative values. Raised in Connecticut, she received a BFA in Music Theatre from Elon University. She is based in Brooklyn, NY.

Vincent Marini

Executive Producer

Vincent Marini is the executive producer of MAGIC MIKE LIVE around the world. He has led the development of the show and its groundbreaking venues in Las Vegas, London, Berlin and Australia, with an arena tour and an unscripted television series on the horizon. Vincent recently spent four years as the creative director and executive producer of BASE Entertainment. Productions: MAGIC MIKE LIVE (Executive Producer); MAT FRANCO: MAGIC REINVENTED NIGHTLY (Writer/Director); PUPPET UP UNCESORED! with Brian Henson (Executive Producer); PAUL ZERDIN: MOUTHING OFF (Executive Producer); FRANKIE MORENO: UNDER THE INFLUENCE (Writer/Director). From 2009-2014 Vincent served as the producing artistic director for The State Theatre of North Carolina which welcomed close to 100,000 patrons annually to two unique venues. Productions: ZELDA with Frank Wildhorn and Jack Murphy; MY OWN SONG with Clint Holmes; LES MIS√âRABLES; THE FANTASTICKS; MISS SAIGON; THE LAST FIVE YEARS; A FEW GOOD MEN and many others. Other directing/producing credits: the international tour of JEKYLL AND HYDE IN CONCERT; television performances on THE VOICE, GERMANY‚ÄôS NEXT TOP MODELl, and BRITAIN‚ÄôS GOT TALENT; The Barrymore Awards for Theatre Excellence; THE ROCK TENOR at the Wilma Theater; and over sixty plays and musicals. Vincent served as a special consultant to Cirque du Soleil‚Äôs new theatrical division in 2014, on the boards of the New Jersey Cultural Trust and The Theatre Alliance of Greater Philadelphia (Interim Executive Director in 2007) and as an adjudicator for the North Carolina Theater Conference. He has also served as a guest lecturer at Temple University, Brevard College and the Kanazwa Institute of Technology in Tokyo, Japan.
